bug.author: shantanuchhabra
bug.summary: Inconsistent output schema for model.stylize between 5.8 and current master.
bug.description:
As of current master, the output SFrame of model.stylize on an SArray with multiple content images does not have a row_id column to reference the row in the input SFrame. Repro:
Load a model trained using Turi Create 5.8 in Turi Create 6.0rc1. Model shared internally. Call model.stylize on an SArray with 2 content images.
Actual output: <denchmark-code>Columns: style_idx int stylized_image Image
Rows: 16
Data: +-----------+------------------------+ | style_idx | stylized_image | +-----------+------------------------+ | 0 | Height: 600 Width: 447 | | 0 | Height: 600 Width: 447 | | 1 | Height: 600 Width: 447 | | 1 | Height: 600 Width: 447 | | 2 | Height: 600 Width: 447 | | 2 | Height: 600 Width: 447 | | 3 | Height: 600 Width: 447 | | 3 | Height: 600 Width: 447 | | 4 | Height: 600 Width: 447 | | 4 | Height: 600 Width: 447 | +-----------+------------------------+ </denchmark-code>
Expected: Another column in the SFrame called row_id to match 5.8 which refers to the row number in the input SFrame. example output from TC 5.8: <denchmark-code>Columns: row_id int style int stylized_image Image
Rows: 8
Data: +--------+-------+------------------------+ | row_id | style | stylized_image | +--------+-------+------------------------+ | 0 | 0 | Height: 600 Width: 447 | | 0 | 1 | Height: 600 Width: 447 | | 0 | 2 | Height: 600 Width: 447 | | 0 | 3 | Height: 600 Width: 447 | | 0 | 4 | Height: 600 Width: 447 | | 0 | 5 | Height: 600 Width: 447 | | 0 | 6 | Height: 600 Width: 447 | | 0 | 7 | Height: 600 Width: 447 | +--------+-------+------------------------+ [8 rows x 3 columns]
</denchmark-code>

comments.comment: After an initial investigation, seems like fixing this will involve more of a code change than I initially anticipated. We may have to add a option in the data iterator that would then return the row index from the input SFrame as well. Currently, the data iterator doesnâ€™t store or return the row number in the original dataset. <denchmark-link:https://github.com/abhishekpratapa>@abhishekpratapa</denchmark-link> thoughts?
